questions.question_text: Which two protocols are available on a Palo Alto Networks Firewall Interface Management Profile? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AD
Correct..HTTP,HTTPS,SSH and TELNET

Selected Answer: CD
IntraZone. So only traffic within the same zone is allowed

Selected Answer: CD
C and D are correct.

questions.question_text:
A network administrator created an intrazone Security policy rule on the firewall. The source zones were set to IT. Finance, and HR.

Which two types of traffic will the rule apply to? (Choose two)

choices.B: traffic between zone Finance and zone HR
choices.A: traffic between zone IT and zone Finance

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Antivirus prevent from malware downloading

Selected Answer: D
Option D
Data filtering profiles are used for:
Use Data Filtering profiles to prevent sensitive, confidential, and proprietary information from leaving your network. Predefined patterns, built-in settings, and customizable options make it easy for you to protect files that contain certain file properties (such as a document title or author), credit card numbers, regulated information from different countries (like social security numbers), and third-party data loss prevention (DLP) labels. 
https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/network-security/security-policy/security-profiles/security-profile-data-filtering

Selected Answer: D
Antivirus
The default profile inspects all the listed protocol decoders for viruses and generates alerts for the SMTP, IMAP, and POP3 protocols while blocking the FTP, HTTP, and SMB protocols.
(PCNSA) | Study Guide p86

Answer should be D. The antivirus profile detects malware in the traffic stream and prevents them from being downloaded. Naturally the firewall becomes aware of the latest threats after updating its database.

comments.content: Sorry It's my fault, D is the right answer.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
I vote for B

Answer B.
You go to an FTP server. Therefor an OUTBOUND rule.
Makes only B a viable answer.

choices.A: Data Filtering profile applied to outbound Security policy rules.
choices.C: URL Filtering profile applied to inbound Security policy rules.
choices.B: Vulnerability Protection profile applied to outbound Security policy rules.
choices.D: Antivirus profile applied to inbound Security policy rules.

questions.question_text:
You receive notification about new malware that infects hosts through malicious files transferred by FTP.

Which Security profile detects and protects your internal networks from this threat after you update your firewallâ€™s threat signature database?

An administrator would like to override the default deny action for a given application, and instead would like to block the traffic.

Which security policy action causes this?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
You can set a drop action to send a type 3 ICMP, but "Drop, send ICMP Unreachable" is not the name of any action. The right answer is A.

Selected Answer: B
B is the right answer, it's the same as Q.150

comments.content:
If you check the possible value of the actions, it can be : Allow, deny,drop,drop-icmp, RST client , RST server, RST both
So you are not right.

There is the action like that, here is the information.
https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/pan-os/9-1/pan-os-admin/policy/security-policy/security-policy-actions

or Layer 3 interfaces, to optionally send an ICMP unreachable response to the client, set Action: Drop and enable the Send ICMP Unreachable check box. When enabled, the firewall sends the ICMP code
Technically the action is indeed "Drop", the tick box of the "Send ICMP..." is optional. So yeah, John is correct.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
There is no security policy action " Drop, send ICMP Unreachable", it is only drop.

Selected Answer: C
C is correct

Selected Answer: C
Correct. An application filter is an object that dynamically groups applications based on application attributes that you define, including category, subcategory, technology, risk factor, and characteristic. 
https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/pan-os/11-0/pan-os-admin/app-id/use-application-objects-in-policy/create-an-application-filter

questions.question_text: What does an application filter help you to do?

choices.B: It dynamically filters applications based on critical, high, medium, low, or informational severity.
choices.A: It dynamically shapes defined application traffic based on active sessions and bandwidth usage.
choices.D: It dynamically provides application statistics based on network, threat, and blocked activity.
choices.C: It dynamically groups applications based on application attributes such as category and subcategory.
